title: Of Credit
text: In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of so much of the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible individual for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,100.

logical_structure.result: In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of so much of the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible individual for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,100.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(a)Allowance Of Credit—In the case of an eligible individual, there shall be allowed as a credit against
                  the tax imposed by this subtitle for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable
                  percentage of so much of the qualified retirement savings contributions of the eligible
                  individual for the taxable year as do not exceed $2,100.

title: Returns
text: In the case of a joint return, the applicable percentage is——if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is not over $30,000, 50 percent,—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $30,000 but not over $32,500, 20 percent,—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $32,500 but not over $50,000, 10 percent, and—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $50,000, zero percent.
conditions: the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is not over $30,000, 50 percent,—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $30,000 but not over $32,500, 20 percent,—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $32,500 but not over $50,000, 10 percent, and—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $50,000, zero percent.

if: the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is not over $30,000, 50 percent,—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $30,000 but not over $32,500, 20 percent,—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $32,500 but not over $50,000, 10 percent, and—
the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $50,000, zero percent.
logical_structure.result: In the case of a joint return, the applicable percentage is——

I.R.C. § 25B(b)(1)Joint Returns—In the case of a joint return, the applicable percentage is—I.R.C. § 25B(b)(1)(A)—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is not over $30,000, 50 percent,I.R.C. § 25B(b)(1)(B)—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $30,000 but not over $32,500,
                        20 percent,I.R.C. § 25B(b)(1)(C)—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $32,500 but not over $50,000,
                        10 percent, andI.R.C. § 25B(b)(1)(D)—if the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer is over $50,000, zero percent.

title: Returns
text: In the case of——a head of household, the applicable percentage shall be determined under paragraph(1)except that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount therein (as adjusted under paragraph(3)) a dollar amount equal to 75 percent of such dollar amount, and—any taxpayer not described in paragraph(1)or subparagraph(A), the applicable percentage shall be determined under paragraph(1)except that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount therein (as adjusted under paragraph(3)) a dollar amount equal to 50 percent of such dollar amount.

that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount therein (as adjusted under paragraph(3)) a dollar amount equal to 50 percent of such dollar amount.

                        therein (as adjusted under paragraph(3)) a dollar amount equal to 75 percent of such dollar amount, andI.R.C. § 25B(b)(2)(B)—any taxpayer not described in paragraph(1)or subparagraph(A), the applicable percentage shall be determined under paragraph(1)except that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount
                        therein (as adjusted under paragraph(3)) a dollar amount equal to 50 percent of such dollar amount.

title: Adjustment
text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2006, each of the dollar amounts in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to——such dollar amount, multiplied by—the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting “calendar year 2005” for “calendar year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.Any increase determined under the preceding sentence shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $500.

logical_structure.result: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2006, each of the dollar amounts in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to——such dollar amount, multiplied by—the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting “calendar year 2005” for “calendar year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.Any increase determined under the preceding sentence shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $500.

I.R.C. § 25B(b)(3)Inflation Adjustment—In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2006, each of the
                     dollar amounts in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—I.R.C. § 25B(b)(3)(A)—such dollar amount, multiplied byI.R.C. § 25B(b)(3)(B)—the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section1(f)(3)for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting
                        “calendar year 2005” for “calendar year 2016” in subparagraph(A)(ii)thereof.Any increase determined under the preceding sentence shall be rounded to the nearest
                        multiple of $500.

title: General
text: The term “eligible individual” means any individual if such individual has attained the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.
conditions: such individual has attained the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.

if: such individual has attained the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.
logical_structure.result: The term “eligible individual” means any individual

                     the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.

requirements: any individual if such individual has attained the age of 18 as of the close of the taxable year.

title: And Full
text: Time Students Not Eligible—The term “eligible individual” shall not include——any individual with respect to whom a deduction under section151is allowed to another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar year in which such individual's taxable year begins, and—any individual who is a student (as defined in section152(f)(2)).

I.R.C. § 25B(c)(2)Dependents And Full-Time Students Not Eligible—The term “eligible individual” shall not include—I.R.C. § 25B(c)(2)(A)—any individual with respect to whom a deduction under section151is allowed to another taxpayer for a taxable year beginning in the calendar year
                        in which such individual's taxable year begins, andI.R.C. § 25B(c)(2)(B)—any individual who is a student (as defined in section152(f)(2)).

title: General
text: The term “qualified retirement savings contributions” means, with respect to any taxable year, the sum of——the amount of contributions made by the eligible individual during such taxable year to the ABLE account (within the meaning of section529A) of which such individual is the designated beneficiary, and—in the case of any taxable year beginning before January 1, 2027——the amount of the qualified retirement contributions (as defined in section219(e)) made by the eligible individual,—the amount of——any elective deferrals (as defined in section402(g)(3)) of such individual, and—any elective deferral of compensation by such individual under an eligible deferred compensation plan (as defined in section457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section457(e)(1)(A), and—the amount of voluntary employee contributions by such individual to any qualified retirement plan (as defined in section4974(c)).

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified retirement savings contributions” means, with respect to any taxable year, the sum of——the amount of contributions made by the eligible individual during such taxable year to the ABLE account (within the meaning of section529A) of which such individual is the designated beneficiary, and—in the case of any taxable year beginning before January 1, 2027——the amount of the qualified retirement contributions (as defined in section219(e)) made by the eligible individual,—the amount of——any elective deferrals (as defined in section402(g)(3)) of such individual, and—any elective deferral of compensation by such individual under an eligible deferred compensation plan (as defined in section457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section457(e)(1)(A), and—the amount of voluntary employee contributions by such individual to any qualified retirement plan (as defined in section4974(c)).

                        to the ABLE account (within the meaning of section529A) of which such individual is the designated beneficiary, andI.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)—in the case of any taxable year beginning before January 1, 2027—I.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)(i)—the amount of the qualified retirement contributions (as defined in section219(e)) made by the eligible individual,I.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)(ii)—the amount of—I.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)(ii)(I)—any elective deferrals (as defined in section402(g)(3)) of such individual, andI.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)(ii)(II)—any elective deferral of compensation by such individual under an eligible deferred
                              compensation plan (as defined in section457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section457(e)(1)(A), andI.R.C. § 25B(d)(1)(B)(iii)—the amount of voluntary employee contributions by such individual to any qualified
                           retirement plan (as defined in section4974(c)).

title: General
text: The qualified retirement savings contributions determined under paragraph (1) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the aggregate distributions received by the individual during the testing period from any entity of a type to which contributions under paragraph (1) may be made. The preceding sentence shall not apply to the portion of any distribution which is not includible in gross income by reason of a trustee-to-trustee transfer or a rollover distribution.

logical_structure.result: The qualified retirement savings contributions determined under paragraph (1) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by the aggregate distributions received by the individual during the testing period from any entity of a type to which contributions under paragraph (1) may be made. The preceding sentence shall not apply to the portion of any distribution which is not includible in gross income by reason of a trustee-to-trustee transfer or a rollover distribution.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(A)In General—The qualified retirement savings contributions determined under paragraph (1) shall
                        be reduced (but not below zero) by the aggregate distributions received by the individual
                        during the testing period from any entity of a type to which contributions under paragraph (1) may
                        be made. The preceding sentence shall not apply to the portion of any distribution
                        which is not includible in gross income by reason of a trustee-to-trustee transfer
                        or a rollover distribution.

title: Period
text: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the testing period, with respect to a taxable year, is the period which includes——such taxable year,—the 2 preceding taxable years, and—the period after such taxable year and before the due date (including extensions) for filing the return of tax for such taxable year.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the testing period, with respect to a taxable year, is the period which includes——such taxable year,—the 2 preceding taxable years, and—the period after such taxable year and before the due date (including extensions) for filing the return of tax for such taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(B)Testing Period—For purposes of subparagraph (A), the testing period, with respect to a taxable year,
                        is the period which includes—I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(B)(i)—such taxable year,I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(B)(ii)—the 2 preceding taxable years, andI.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(B)(iii)—the period after such taxable year and before the due date (including extensions)
                           for filing the return of tax for such taxable year.

title: Distributions
text: There shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A)——any distribution referred to in section72(p),401(k)(8),401(m)(6),402(g)(2),404(k), or408(d)(4), and—any distribution to which section408A(d)(3)applies.

logical_structure.result: There shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A)——any distribution referred to in section72(p),401(k)(8),401(m)(6),402(g)(2),404(k), or408(d)(4), and—any distribution to which section408A(d)(3)applies.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(C)Excepted Distributions—There shall not be taken into account under subparagraph(A)—I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(C)(i)—any distribution referred to in section72(p),401(k)(8),401(m)(6),402(g)(2),404(k), or408(d)(4), andI.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(C)(ii)—any distribution to which section408A(d)(3)applies.

title: Of Distributions Received By Spouse Of Individual
text: Treatment Of Distributions Received By Spouse Of Individual — For purposes of determining distributions received by an individual under subparagraph (A) for any taxable year, any distribution received by the spouse of such individual shall be treated as received by such individual if such individual and spouse file a joint return for such taxable year and for the taxable year during which the spouse receives the distribution.
conditions: such individual and spouse file a joint return for such taxable year and for the taxable year during which the spouse receives the distribution.

if: such individual and spouse file a joint return for such taxable year and for the taxable year during which the spouse receives the distribution.
logical_structure.result: Treatment Of Distributions Received By Spouse Of Individual — For purposes of determining distributions received by an individual under subparagraph (A) for any taxable year, any distribution received by the spouse of such individual shall be treated as received by such individual

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(d)(2)(D)Treatment Of Distributions Received By Spouse Of Individual—Treatment Of Distributions Received By Spouse Of Individual — For purposes of determining
                        distributions received by an individual under subparagraph (A) for any taxable year,
                        any distribution received by the spouse of such individual shall be treated as received
                        by such individual if such individual and spouse file a joint return for such taxable
                        year and for the taxable year during which the spouse receives the distribution.

title: Gross Income
text: For purposes of this section, adjusted gross income shall be determined without regard to sections911,931, and933.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this section, adjusted gross income shall be determined without regard to sections911,931, and933.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(e)Adjusted Gross Income—For purposes of this section, adjusted gross income shall be determined without regard
                  to sections911,931, and933.

title: In The Contract
text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a qualified retirement savings contribution shall not fail to be included in determining the investment in the contract for purposes of section72by reason of the credit under this section.

logical_structure.result: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a qualified retirement savings contribution shall not fail to be included in determining the investment in the contract for purposes of section72by reason of the credit under this section.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25B(f)Investment In The Contract—Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a qualified retirement savings contribution
                  shall not fail to be included in determining the investment in the contract for purposes
                  of section72by reason of the credit under this section.
